definitions: A worsening or flare-up of asthma symptoms, often triggered by an infection, allergen, or irritant, leading to increased shortness of breath, wheezing, chest tightness, and coughing.
examples: An asthma exacerbation requires prompt medical attention.
Preventing an asthma exacerbation is key to managing the condition.
Symptoms of an asthma exacerbation include severe wheezing.
